<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Shadow Giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3016)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Shadow giants are natives of [the Netherworld](/Planes.aspx?ID=36), where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia. They live in familiar groups and uphold a nomadic way of life as they roam across ancestral lands between shadowy forests and misty chasms. These hunter-gatherers pass down lore through oral histories, conduct pilgrimages to unholy ziggurats of black stone, and bathe in the blood of their long-standing foes, including rival shadow giant clans and fiends of the Netherworld intent on enslaving their kind.

 Standing 15 feet tall, with gray skin and hair only a shade lighter, shadow giants are fearsome foes with a well-earned reputation as zealous warmongers and ruthless combatants. They rarely interact with outsiders, though they may treat with proven warriors who show the giants the respect and deference they feel they deserve.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 31

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Shadow_Giant.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 13">[Shadow Giant](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3016)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Giant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=616" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
<trait label="Shadow" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=693" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 168 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Jotun](/Languages.aspx?ID=8), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +24, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +21

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** +2

**Con** +5

**Int** +0

**Wis** +1

**Cha** +3
</row>

**Items**
_+1 [resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2786) [breastplate](/Armor.aspx?ID=47)_, _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2829) [spiked chain](/Weapons.aspx?ID=417)_

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 33 

**Fort** +25 

**Ref** +20 

**Will** +23 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 275

</row>

**[Reactive Strike](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=48)** <actions string="Reaction" /> 

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 35 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
_spiked chain_ +27 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 3d8+18 slashing plus pall of shadow

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +26 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+18 bludgeoning plus pall of shadow

**Pall of Shadow**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) When a shadow giant hits with a melee attack, the target must succeed at a DC 30 Fortitude save or become [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=68) and take a –1 status penalty to Perception checks involving sight as long as they remain drained. On a critical failure, this condition doesn't heal naturally and can be removed only with magic.

**Shadow Chain** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143), [Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) Shadows extend the giant's chain as they make a spiked chain Strike, increasing their reach to 60 feet for that Strike. If this hits, the target must succeed at a DC 33 Will save or be teleported to an empty space within the shadow giant's normal reach.

**Shadowcloak** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) The shadow giant gains the effect of the [_blur_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1455) spell for 1 minute or until it is exposed to direct sunlight, whichever comes first.

</column>
